Getting StartedÂ¶

Create an account at Github. Create a new project (e.g. first). Copy the link to the project which should look like https://github.com/username/projectname.git. On the local machine create a directory with the same name as that of the repository name. Add files to the project directory. Install git.

sudo apt-get install git

Name your github account as

git config --global user.name "Name"

Add the email address to your github account by

git config --global user.email "Email"

Now move to the project directory in the command line.

Follow the following commands to modify the entries to the remote project directory.

git init
git add *
git commit -m "Comment about the change"
git remote add origin https://github.com/username/projectname.git
git push -u origin master

To remove any file at the remote repository

git rm file1.txt
git commit -m "removal comments"
